author: cnbc.com
title: Adamas reports 4Q loss
text:
EMERYVILLE, Calif. (AP) _ Adamas Pharmaceuticals Inc. (ADMS) on Thursday reported a loss of $29.4 million in its fourth quarter.
The Emeryville, California-based company said it had a loss of $1.27 per share.
The results did not meet Wall Street expectations. The average estimate of four analysts surveyed by Zacks Investment Research was for a loss of $1.15 per share.
The drugmaker posted revenue of $568,000 in the period.
For the year, the company reported that its loss widened to $89.5 million, or $3.97 per share. Revenue was nearly unchanged at $571,000.
Adamas shares have decreased 19 percent since the beginning of the year. In the final minutes of trading on Thursday, shares hit $27.41, a climb of 60 percent in the last 12 months.
This story was generated by Automated Insights ( http://automatedinsights.com/ap ) using data from Zacks Investment Research. Access a Zacks stock report on ADMS at https://www.zacks.com/ap/ADMS
